title: National Mall and Memorial Parks: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. National Mall and Memorial Parks  is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      All Aboard with Trails & Rails  All aboard for your next National Park adventure! Trails & Rails guides will help you Find Your Park from the comfort of your seat. Ride with our talented Trails & Rails volunteers on many Amtrak routes across the country. Read more   Birding in D.C.  Even in the bustling city of Washington, D.C., opportunities to spot a wide variety of birds abound in an unusual concentration of national parks. Birding is a leisurely hobby that can be done anywhere at any time. Read more   Dr Kings Messages  Learn more about Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his memorial. Read more   Honoring Vietnam Veterans in Granite and Bronze  Learn more about the Vietnam Veterans Memorial Read more   Music at the Monument  A Healthy Parks, Healthy People continuing program. Read more      Call to Action Projects      Park Commemorates 50th Anniversary of March on Washington  Thousands gather to experience in the 50th anniversary of the 1963 March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom. Read more   Park Commemorates 75th Anniversary of Marian Anderson Concert  School students reenact the 1939 Marian Anderson concert, reflecting on civil rights and the importance of National Parks. Read more   Winners Announced in Expressions of Freedom Student Art Competition  Winners were recognized during ceremonies featuring local National Park Service staff.  Read more
